page.title: 08Sywell C of E Primary School
page.content: The new Sywell Primary School was opened in 1964. Sixty-two children attend. School starts at 8.55am and finishes at 3.30pm. At the start of school, the brass bell from the Old School is rung and we walk to our classrooms. The bell used to hang over the old school but it was taken down in 1981 so that we could use it. It now hangs on the wall at the back of the school. About half the children have school dinners which are cooked at the school. They cost 60p. Dinners are also cooked here for Boughton School and Overstone School. They are collected and delivered by van. There are two cooks. The rest of the children bring packed lunches. They can buy a drink (orange, milk shake, coffee or chocolate) which costs 5p and is ordered at the start of the day. There are two lunchtime supervisors.
